intro: Brongniartia zirandarensis, commonly known as the Zirandaré cycad, is a rare and ancient plant species native to Brazil. It belongs to the Cycadaceae family and is characterized by its stout, unbranched stem and pinnately compound leaves. The plant produces large, cone-like structures that contain both male and female reproductive organs. Due to habitat loss and over-collection, it is considered critically endangered, making conservation efforts crucial for its survival. Its unique morphology and evolutionary history make it an important subject in botanical research.
